IN.IC: je oblika za sedanjik in pretekli deležnik.

sense.def:
Z besedo
to come
povemo, da nekdo ali nekaj nekam prispe ali se pomika proti nam.

seg.quote: She looked up when they came into the room.
She eventually came to the town of Pickering.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
comes to a particular point
, doseže določeno točko.

seg.quote: Her hair came right down to her waist.
Mum doesn't even come up to my shoulder.

sense.def:
Besedo
to come
uporabljamo v izrazih, s katerimi povemo, kaj se nekomu ali nečemu dogaja.

seg.quote: It just came apart in my hands.
They had come to power ten years earlier.
Ordinary sticky tape comes unstuck.

sense.def:
Kadar človek
comes to do something
, postopoma začne nekaj delati.

seg.quote: I have come to like him quite a lot.

sense.def:
Kadar neki čas ali dogodek
comes
, se zgodi.

seg.quote: The time has come for a full campaign against the government's spending cuts.

sense.def:
Izraz
‘Come to think of it’
pove, da smo nenadoma nekaj ugotovili.

seg.quote: Come to think of it, why should I apologize?

sense.def:
Kadar nekdo ali nekaj
comes from a particular place or thing
, je tisti kraj ali stvar njegov vzrok ali začetek.

seg.quote: ‘Where do you come from?’—‘India.’
Information coming out of the country was unreliable.
Did you know the word ‘idea’ comes from Greek?

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
comes from something else
, je tisto posledica nečesa drugega.

seg.quote: ...the warm glow that comes from working co-operatively.
I'll let you know what comes of the meeting.

sense.def:
Kadar nekdo ali nekaj
comes first, next, or last
, je tisti ali tisto prvo, naslednje ali zadnje v vrsti, seznamu ali na tekmovanju.

seg.quote: What comes next then?
I was never in any race in which I didn't come last.

sense.def:
Kadar izdelek
comes in a particular range of colours, styles, or sizes
, je na voljo v eni od naštetih barv, oblik ali velikosti.

seg.quote: The van came in two colours, medium brown or medium grey.

sense.def:
Način, kako nekaj
comes about
, pomeni, kako se nekaj zgodi.

seg.quote: The discovery of adrenalin came about through a mistake.

sense.def:
Kadar človek
comes across
ali
comes upon someone or something
, tisto ali tistega sreča ali najde po naključju.

seg.quote: I came across a letter from Brunel the other day.
They rounded a turn and came upon a family of lions.

sense.def:
Način, kako nekdo
comes across
, je vtis, ki ga naredi na druge.

seg.quote: He wasn't coming across as the idiot I had expected him to be.

sense.def:
Kadar neka ideja ali pomen
comes across
, natančno razumemo, za kaj gre.

seg.quote: Do you think this idea comes across in the play?

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
comes along
, tisto pride ali se zgodi, morda po naključju.

seg.quote: A new generation of planners came along who were much more scientifically based.

sense.def:
Kadar človek ali žival
comes at someone
ali
comes for someone
, se grozeče pomika proti tistemu človeku.

seg.quote: The bear came at me.
Jake was coming for me with a knife.

sense.def:
To come back to a topic or point
pomeni vrniti se k neki témi ali točki.

seg.quote: We'll come back to that question a little later.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
comes back to someone
, se tisti človek spomni nečesa, kar je že pozabil.

Kadar nekaj
comes back
, znova pride v modo.

seg.quote: She was pleased to see that mini skirts were coming back.

sense.def:
To come by something
pomeni nekaj najti ali pridobiti.

seg.quote: He had not come by these things through his own labour.
Jobs were hard to come by.

sense.def:
Kadar cena, raven ali količina nečesa
comes down
, postane manjša ali nižja kakor prej.

seg.quote: Inflation is starting to come down.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj visokega, na primer stavba ali drevo,
comes down
, pade na tla.

seg.quote: In the storm a tree came down.

sense.def:
To come down on someone
pomeni nekoga kritizirati.

seg.quote: Social workers like me come down harder on parents than on their children.

sense.def:
Kadar neki problem ali odločitev
comes down to a particular thing
, je tista stvar najpomembnejši dejavnik.

seg.quote: Your final choice of kitchen may well come down to cost.

sense.def:
To come down with an illness
pomeni dobiti neko bolezen.

seg.quote: She came down with pneumonia.

sense.def:
Kadar človek
comes forward
, izrazi pripravljenost, da bi nekaj storil.

seg.quote: More coloured men are now coming forward to join the police.

sense.def:
Kadar neka informacija ali poročilo
comes in
, ga prejmemo.

seg.quote: Reports are coming in from Mexico of a major earthquake.

sense.def:
To have money coming in
pomeni redno prejemati dohodek.

Kadar človek
comes in on a discussion or an arrangement
, se pridruži neki razpravi ali ureditvi.

seg.quote: He should come in on the deal.

sense.def:
Kadar nekdo ali nekaj
comes in
ali
comes into a situation
, je vpleten v določene okoliščine.

seg.quote: Where does your husband come in?
Prestige comes into it as much as other factors.

sense.def:
Kadar nekdo ali nekaj
comes in for criticism or blame
, je deležen kritike ali graje.

Kadar človek
comes into money or property
, podeduje denar ali imetje.

seg.quote: She was going to come into some more money on her mother's death.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
comes off
, je uspešno in učinkovito.

seg.quote: Sotheby's publicity stunt came off brilliantly.

sense.def:
Kadar nekomu rečemo
‘come on’
ali
‘come along’
, ga opogumimo, naj nekaj stori, ali pa ga priganjamo.

seg.quote: Come on, Wendy, you say something.
Come along, now, drink this.

sense.def:
To have got a cold or a headache coming on
pomeni, da se nas loteva prehlad ali glavobol.

seg.quote: I felt a cold coming on.

sense.def:
To be coming on
ali
to be coming along
pomeni, da se nekaj razvija ali napreduje.

seg.quote: My new book is coming on quite well.

sense.def:
Kadar neki stroj ali priprava
comes on
, začne delovati.

seg.quote: The lights came on.

sense.def:
To come on to a particular topic
pomeni začeti razpravo o neki témi.

seg.quote: I want to come on to the question of disease in a minute.

sense.def:
Kadar neka informacija
comes out
, je razkrita ali pride v javnost.

seg.quote: All the facts came out after Seery's death.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj, na primer knjiga,
comes out
, jo objavijo ali postane dostopna javnosti.

seg.quote: She asked me to send her any new stamps which might come out.

sense.def:
To come out in a particular way
pomeni biti v opisanem položaju ali stanju na koncu postopka ali dogodka.

seg.quote: Who do you think will come out on top?
The press was coming out of the affair very badly.

sense.def:
To come out for something
pomeni izjaviti, da nekaj podpiramo.

seg.quote: He came out in support of the claim.

sense.def:
Kadar neka fotografija
comes out
, so jo uspešno razvili.

Kadar sonce, mesec ali zvezde
come out
, se prikažejo na nebu.

To come out in spots
pomeni postati lisast.

Kadar čustvo
comes over someone
, človeka gane.

seg.quote: She wondered what could have come over him all of a sudden.

sense.def:
Kadar človek
comes over
, nekoga za krajši čas obišče na njegovem domu.

seg.quote: You can come over tomorrow at four.

sense.def:
To come round to an idea
pomeni, da smo si navsezadnje premislili in zamisel sprejeli.

seg.quote: He knew I would have to come round to his way of thinking in the end.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
comes round
, se zgodi kot reden ali napovedljiv dogodek.

seg.quote: Don't wait for April to come round before planning your vegetable garden.

sense.def:
Kadar nezavesten človek
comes round
ali
comes to
, se znova zbudi iz nezavesti.

seg.quote: That's about all I remember, until I came to in a life-raft.

sense.def:
To come through a dangerous or difficult situation
pomeni preživeti nevarne ali težavne okoliščine.

seg.quote: Most of the troops came through the fighting unharmed.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
comes through
, tisto dobimo.

seg.quote: Has my visa come through yet?

sense.def:
Kadar lastnost ali vtis
comes through
, ga zaznamo.

seg.quote: I think the teacher's own personality has got to come through.

sense.def:
Kadar neka misel ali ideja
comes to someone
, se je nekdo nenadoma zave.

seg.quote: The answer came to him just before noon.
It came to me suddenly that what was wrong was that I was tired.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj, na primer znesek,
comes to a particular number or amount
, seže do določenega števila ali zneska.

seg.quote: My income now comes to £65 a week.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
comes under a particular authority
, pade ali pride pod določeno oblast.

seg.quote: Day Nurseries come under the Department of Health and Social Security.

sense.def:
To come under criticism or attack
pomeni, da nas nekdo kritizira ali napada.

seg.quote: British produce came under pressure from foreign competition.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
comes under a particular heading
, je v omenjeni kategoriji.

seg.quote: Records and tapes come under published material.

sense.def:
Kadar neka téma
comes up in a conversation or meeting
, ali kadar človek
comes up with it
, tisto témo omenijo ali o njej razpravljajo v pogovoru ali na sestanku.

seg.quote: His name came up at a buffet lunch.
I hope to come up with some of the answers.

sense.def:
Kadar dogodek
is coming up
, se bo vsak čas pripetil ali zgodil.

seg.quote: There's a royal wedding coming up.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
comes up
, se zgodi nepričakovano.

seg.quote: I can't see you tonight. Something's come up.

sense.def:
Kadar nekdo
comes up for election
, je znova čas, da sodeluje na volitvah.

seg.quote: A third of my colleagues will come up for election next May.

sense.def:
Kadar neka téma ali politika
comes up for review
, je čas, da o njej znova razpravljamo.

seg.quote: The pension scheme has come up for review.

sense.def:
Kadar sonce ali luna
comes up
, vzide.

seg.quote: The sun comes up in the East.

sense.def:
Kadar človek
comes up against a problem or difficulty
, se mora soočiti z nekim problemom ali težavo.

seg.quote: Everyone comes up against discrimination sooner or later.

sense.def:
To be coming up to a time or state
pomeni bližati se nekemu času ali stanju.

seg.quote: Some of them are coming up to retirement.
It was just coming up to ten o'clock.
